[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Trait: CompiledCodeMetadata::version()] [Version rollback] Can downgrading the version from V1 to V0 allow attackers to use deprecated features that have known vulnerabilities but are only checked in newer versions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Implementation: CompiledModule::version()] [Version-metadata mismatch] Can a module claim version 6+ (supporting V1 metadata) but contain V0 metadata format, causing deserialization errors or validation bypasses? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Trait: CompiledCodeMetadata::metadata()] [Unvalidated iteration] Does returning raw &[Metadata] allow callers to iterate without checking for malicious metadata keys, potentially processing attacker-controlled data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Trait: CompiledCodeMetadata::metadata()] [Key collision] Can attackers add metadata with keys that collide with system keys (APTOS_METADATA_KEY, COMPILATION_METADATA_KEY) to confuse find_metadata() and return attacker-controlled data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Trait: CompiledCodeMetadata::metadata()] [Metadata ordering] Can the order of metadata entries affect validation outcomes, allowing attackers to place malicious entries before legitimate ones to bypass checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Trait: CompiledCodeMetadata::metadata()] [Metadata value size] Can extremely large metadata values (megabytes in size) cause memory exhaustion when accessed through metadata(), enabling DoS attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Trait: CompiledCodeMetadata] [Validation bypass] Can the trait's simple interface allow malicious code to pass initial trait-based checks but fail in subsequent validation, causing inconsistent state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Trait: CompiledCodeMetadata::version()] [Compilation metadata check] Can an attacker craft code where version() returns a valid value but get_compilation_metadata() finds unstable=true, creating a discrepancy that bypasses mainnet rejection? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Trait: CompiledCodeMetadata::metadata()] [Check bypass] Can code with valid metadata() output bypass check_metadata_format() by having structurally valid but semantically malicious metadata content? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Implementation: CompiledModule] [Module publishing bypass] Can a malicious CompiledModule pass trait checks but fail verify_module_metadata_for_module_publishing() after being cached, allowing cached invalid modules? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Implementation: CompiledScript] [Script execution bypass] Can a CompiledScript with manipulated version() or metadata() execute on mainnet despite having unstable compilation metadata? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Trait: CompiledCodeMetadata::metadata()] [Cache poisoning] If metadata() results are cached (as in V1_METADATA_CACHE), can an attacker provide identical metadata.value bytes but with different interpretation to poison the cache? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Trait: CompiledCodeMetadata::metadata()] [Cache invalidation] Can changes to the underlying CompiledModule/CompiledScript metadata not invalidate LRU caches, causing stale metadata to be used in security checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Trait: CompiledCodeMetadata] [Cache key collision] Can two different modules/scripts produce the same cache key from their metadata, causing one's cached metadata to be incorrectly used for the other? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Trait: CompiledCodeMetadata] [Missing trait bounds] Does the trait lack bounds like Send or Sync that could cause safety issues when CompiledCodeMetadata is used across threads in parallel execution? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Trait: CompiledCodeMetadata] [Trait object safety] Can the trait be used as a trait object (dyn CompiledCodeMetadata) to bypass static type checking and cause type confusion in validation code? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Implementation: CompiledModule] [Field visibility] Does directly accessing self.version and self.metadata bypass any validation or normalization that should occur when retrieving these fields? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Implementation: CompiledScript] [Script constraints] Does the trait allow CompiledScript to be treated identically to CompiledModule in contexts where scripts have different security requirements? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Trait: CompiledCodeMetadata::version()] [Zero version] Can version() return 0, and does this value cause divide-by-zero errors, array index issues, or bypass version checks that assume version >= 1? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Trait: CompiledCodeMetadata::metadata()] [Empty slice] Can metadata() return an empty slice &[], and does this cause check_metadata_format() or verify_module_metadata_for_module_publishing() to incorrectly pass validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Trait: CompiledCodeMetadata::metadata()] [Single element] If metadata() returns exactly one Metadata entry, can this bypass checks that expect multiple entries or specific orderings? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Implementation: CompiledModule] [Corrupted version field] If a CompiledModule is deserialized with a corrupted version field, does version() return the corrupted value without validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Implementation: CompiledScript] [Script metadata limits] Can CompiledScript carry arbitrarily large metadata vectors that aren't subject to module complexity checks in check_module_complexity()? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Trait: CompiledCodeMetadata] [Deserialization state] If a CompiledModule/CompiledScript is partially deserialized when accessed through the trait, can this cause inconsistent version/metadata values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vm/code.rs] [Trait: CompiledCodeMetadata::metadata()] [BCS deserialization bypass] Can metadata contain valid BCS-serialized data that deserializes to malicious RuntimeModuleMetadataV1 structures not caught by type-level checks? (High)
